intro: Clypeola jonthlaspi, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. The plant has basal leaves that are pinnately divided, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Clypeola jonthlaspi is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in mountainous areas across the Northern Hemisphere.
